$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/alternat.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/alternatives
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/alternat.creator: Thomas Elmiger
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/alternat.text:
!! Alternatives

!!! SVG from Wikipedia
On https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvey_Balls you will find alternative graphics in one single SVG file. There are neither tiltes nor descriptions in this image.

!!! Fonts
Some fonts like Arial Unicode MS contain symbols similar to Harvey balls:

@@font-size:2em; 
○●◯◔◑◕◐◒◓◖◗◝◞◟◜◝◡◉◌◍◎☹☺☻
@@

These are found starting around U+25CB (white circle). I don’t know if or how a screenreader would announce them. Other dedicated fonts with Harvey balls are available, I found some using the numbers from 0 to 9 and I guess a screenreader would announce them as such. Would numbers from 0 to 9 convey enough meaning to your users? Then you should use numbers instead of Harvey balls if you ask me.

!! Accessibility

In general font solutions as well as monolithic SVG graphics lack the ability to control or adapt the meaning of the symbols/characters.

There is no hint popping up from a font if a user hovers over the icon with the pointer of the mouse. 

With my SVG solution, the title is shown as a hint and ~VoiceOver on the Mac announces both title and desc attributes.

$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/icons.cs.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/icons.css
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/icons.cs.creator: Thomas Elmiger

$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/macros.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/macros
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/macros.creator: Thomas Elmiger
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/macros.text:
\define HarveyBall(variant:"empty")
<$vars ball="""$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/$variant$/icon.svg"""><$transclude tiddler=<<ball>>/></$vars>
\end

\define HB0() <<HarveyBall empty>>
\define HB1() <<HarveyBall quarter>>
\define HB2() <<HarveyBall half>>
\define HB3() <<HarveyBall quarter-empty>>
\define HB4() <<HarveyBall full>>

\define HB5() <<HarveyBall simple>>
\define HB8() <<HarveyBall obvious>>
\define HB13() <<HarveyBall complicated>>
\define HB21() <<HarveyBall complex>>
\define HB34() <<HarveyBall chaotic>>

\define HB(nr:"0")
<$vars macro="""HB$nr$"""><$macrocall $name=<<macro>>/></$vars>
\end

<<HB 4>>

$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/readme.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/readme
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/readme.creator: Thomas Elmiger
$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/readme.text:
\define tr(variant,nr:"") <$vars tit="$:/language/HarveyBalls/$variant$/title" desc="$:/language/HarveyBalls/$variant$/desc" nr="""$nr$"""> {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/$variant$/icon.svg}} <><$link to=<>><$transclude tiddler=<>/> <$link to=<>><$transclude tiddler=<>/> \end !! Harvey Balls Harvey Balls are round ideograms used for visual communication of qualitative information. They are commonly used in comparison tables to indicate the degree to which a particular item meets a particular criterion. !!! Macros for display The same as `{{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/half/icon.svg}}` – the Harvey ball <> – would be displayed for all three of the following macros: `<>` `<>` `<>` Titles or numbers of the following tables can be used. !!! Available ideograms //1) more colour is better// <> <> <> <> <>
icon # title desc
//2) less colour is better// <> <> <> <> <>
icon # title desc
!!! Adapt or translate for better accessibility To convey another meaning with your Harvey Balls, it is possible to adapt or translate titles and descriptions. So it is possible to use them e.g. for a performance ratings or a score like: * poor * fair * good * very good * excellent Just click the text in the table above and adapt the content to your needs. The warning is just a reminder that you are overwriting the standard text. You can always delete your own version to return to the original. !!! Control dimensions via font size Inside surrounding text, the Harvey balls adapt themselves in size. Examples: ! Title H1 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/empty/icon.svg}} !! Title H2 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/full/icon.svg}} more text !!! Title H3 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/quarter/icon.svg}} more text !!!! Title H4 {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/half/icon.svg}} more text Normal text paragraph {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/quarter-empty/icon.svg}} more text or apply [[styling via Wikitext|http://tiddlywiki.com/#Styles%20and%20Classes%20in%20WikiText]]: @@font-size:2em; You will need some text {{$:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/full/icon.svg}} to make this big. @@ !!! Adjust colours via CSS The styling of the balls can be changed # by adapting the style sheet $:/plugins/telmiger/HarveyBalls/icons.css # by adapting surrounding text color in case of the //less colour is better// version (it uses fill="currentColor")
